txt.en:
'No Dwarf of Erebor would do such a thing as steal that necklace. Not a one! But I couldn't vouch for those Stout-axes. Could you?'

You tell Fróthi that you saw Karazgar holding a dragon's tooth.

'Then we know our thief! I am relieved that I need not think poorly of our cousin-dwarves. We know our thief, and how formidable a foe he is, but we do know little of what he is after.'
You should speak with the lore-master Fróthi, who can be found in Erebor.

'There can be truth in visions, [placeholder], though their proper meanings may be riddle-like. \n\n'Hm... yes, I think you ought to follow this path where it leads. I do not know what you will find, but I feel certain the journey will hold answers.'
The lore-master Fróthi ponders the theft of the dragon-tooth necklace from Erebor.
'Hm... yes, I would like to see that one tooth we still possess. Come. Perhaps we will gain some insight into the matter.'
You should speak with Fróthi, who can be found in Erebor.
